By D. DOUGLAS, WILE
University general funds will,
be used to write off the $14,000
deficit of the Student Union
.Desk by June 30, 1978.
According to Norman Krueuer,
Johns Hopkins University Budget
Director, the Desk has been
carrying the debt since Fiscal
Year 1975, when the kiosk in
Levering Hall was established.
Mr. Krueger said that the debt
was largely accumulated due to
unexpected start-up costs. These
expenses were primarily related
to construction and security.
For
the past two years, the desk
has
been operating on a near
break-even basis, he said.
Krueger stated, "We had
anticipated that through
'increased volume, they would be
able to cover the deficit. This

year, we decided there would not
be as much hope of recovering
the debt through the service
center."
Budget Director Krueger also
commented that without the
subsidy, She desk could have paid
off the debt by raising the
merchandise prices drastically.
There have been no interest or
finance charges because the
deficit has remained on the
books within the University.
Chris Columbo, Director of
Student Activities, commented,
"the removal of the debt will
have a positive effect on the
morale of the staff, and of this
office. When I came here in 1974,
there had been poor
management. Now the system of
operating on a break-even basis is
pretty well fixed."
